Teachings ArtLife

Zhenyuan Lu

I am a deep learning scientist at Seurat and AI/ML adjunct factulty at Northeastern University. I received my PhD from Northeastern University focusing on AI/ML. My PhD journey is showcased on the University PhD Network. The College of Engineering released a spotlight for a Student Success Story.

Check out my Python tutorial: Python Notebook from Zero to Advanced or get visual with my R tutorial on Data Visualization/Transformation Tutorial in R. My guide on Data Visualization Data Viz in a Nutshell. When I am not at work, you will find me behind the lens in my very own photography studio, snapping everything from sassy portraits to whimsical whatever.

Field Researches and Teachings at Texas

What is a Good Graduate Program?

I received numerous emails from my students asking about what constitutes a good graduate program. I’d like to share with you some insightful words from Dr. Yiqing Xu of Stanford University (I translated it into English):

  • “The criteria for evaluating a good graduate program is how much time is spent on the continuous accumulation of knowledge and skills (during which the learning curve can be linear or even exponential) and how much time is spent on simple repetitive tasks that do not lead to the improvement of knowledge and skills.”

Hello from Boston.
